respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)
respStmt.name: Matthew Holford

msContents.summary: Liturgical fragments, accessioned before 1976, mostly from bindings of Bodleian MSS and printed books.

msItem.title: Breviary (portable)
msItem.note: Temporale: portion of the historia of Ezechiel; (fol.5) sanctorale, May 3â€“19

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 30 lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: (part of a leaf containing portions of the end of the canon, the Pater noster and the Libera nos)

history.provenance: From the front cover of MS. Bodley 391 (S.C. 2222) which belonged to St. Augustine's, Canterbury

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: (two strips containing portions of the canon from Memento domine to the Supplices te rogamus)

msItem.title: Calendar
msItem.note: (strip containing portions of January and February)

msItem.title: Collectar
msItem.note: (7th (?) and 8th Sundays after Pentecost, fragment of a leaf)

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.note: (fragment of a leaf containing portions of Ps. i and ii)

msItem.title: Breviary (portable)
msItem.note: (strip containing portions of the 3rd nocturne of matins and lauds for St. John the evangelist)

msItem.title: Breviary (portable)
msItem.note: Temporale: portions from Sunday and Monday after the octave of the Epiphany. The correct order of the leaves is probably 24, 21, 26, 22, 23; 21, 26 and 22, 23 being consecutive.

layoutDesc.layout: 19 long lines

msItem.title: Breviary (portable)
msItem.note: (temporale: antiphons for Easter and part of the Sunday after Easter)

layoutDesc.layout: 20 long lines

msItem.title: Sacramentary
msItem.note: (fragment of a leaf containing the bidding prayers for Good Friday and the blessings of incense and fire on Holy Saturday)

msItem.title: Missal (noted)
msItem.note: Sanctorale: portions of the Purification (2 Feb.), of St. Blaise (3 Feb.) and feasts of 17â€“27 March

layoutDesc.layout: notation adiastematic non-rhythmical neums; written in long lines

msItem.title: Breviary (noted choir breviary)
msItem.note: (see MS. Lat. liturg. b. 7, fol. 31, 32)

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum (noted choir breviary)
msItem.note: (sanctorale: portion of the office of Sts. Philip and James (1st May))

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary (noted choir breviary)
msItem.note: Temporale: portions of the 1st week in Advent (fol.38vr), of the 2nd Sunday (fol. 39) and 3rd Sunday (fol. 36)

supportDesc.extent: parts of a single leaf and a bifolium

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Missal (noted)
msItem.note: temporale: portion of Ember Saturday in Advent

layoutDesc.layout: notation adiastematic neums, partly erased and rewritten with Gothic notation on staves of 4 black lines, written in long lines

history.provenance: Taken from MS. Hamilton 48, an Erfurt book

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum (choir breviary)
msItem.note: temporale: portions of the office and services of Easter Sunday

supportDesc.extent: part of the inner bifolium of a quire

2 cols.

msItem.title: Gradual
msItem.note: temporale: offertory of Friday in the 2nd week of Lent to the gradual of the following Sunday, with a fragment of the preceding Ember week

layoutDesc.layout: 19 long lines, notation adiastematic non-rhythmical neums

msItem.note: temporale: Ember Saturday in Lent - Thursday in Passion week

layoutDesc.layout: long lines

msItem.title: Pontifical

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 29 lines, the bottom line cropped by binder. Some square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.note: sanctorale: conception of the Virgin (8 Dec.), and feasts of 20 Dec. - 2 Jan.

msItem.title: Breviary (portable)
msItem.note: Temporale: portions of the week before Christmas, Christmas eve and day. The correct order of the leaves is 82, 81, 80.

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: Temporale: portion of 1st and 2nd Sundays in Advent, Sabbatum IV temporum and Trinity Sunday; sanctorale: portions of the Nativity and Conception of the Virgin, the Exaltation of the Cross (14 Sept.) and St. Matthew (21 Sept.); common of saints from the birth-day of a confessor and bishop to that of several confessors
